title: CIS 111: Computer Science I
description:
Introduction to computer science with emphasis on problem solving and
algorithm development. Using high-level, block-structured programming
language, students design, implement, debug, test, and document computer
programs for various applications.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: Minimum ACT mathematics score of 22; or minimum SAT mathematics score of 540; or Math 121 or above; or ALEKS PPL score of 61Pre-requisite: Non-engineering Majors Only

title: CIS 112: Computer Science II
description:
Continuation of Csci 111 with emphasis on computer programming as a
systematic discipline. The topics include data structures, abstract data
types, algorithm design and analysis, and programming methods and
standards.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Csci 111 or CIS 111 or Csci 113 or CIS 113 (Minimum grade C-).

title: CIS 113: Honors Computer Science I
description:
Introduction to computer science with an emphasis on problem solving and
algorithm development. Using high-level, block-structured programming
language, students will design, implement, debug, test, and document
computer programs.  In addition, topics related to data structures,
abstract data types, algorithm design and analysis will also be
emphasized.
prerequisites: Limited to students in the Sally McDonnell Barksdale Honors CollegePre-requisite: Math ACT 22 or Math 121 (or above)

title: CIS 211: Computer Science III
description:
Continuation of Csci 112 with emphasis on advanced data structures,
algorithm design analysis, advanced programming techniques, and user
interfaces.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Csci 112 (minimum C-) or CIS 112 (minimum C-) or Csci 113 (minimum B-) or CIS 113 (minimum B-)

title: CIS 251: Programming for Engineering and Sciences
description:
Algorithm development and structured programming techniques; numerical
and graphical applications related to engineering and scientific problem
solving.  Co-requisite for this course may also be satisfied by consent
of instructor.

title: CIS 256: Programming in Python
description:
Problem solving, algorithm development, and programming techniques,
including applications from a range of disciplines.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Minimum ACT mathematics score of 22; or minimum SAT mathematics score of 540; or Math 121 or above; or ALEKS PPL score of 61.

title: CIS 333: Digital Design and 3D Printing
description:
This course introduces the principles and methods for computer-aided
design of objects that can be rendered effectively on 3D printers. It
surveys the design techniques and the hardware and software technologies
in 3D printing workflows. Students create designs and render them on 3D
printers.
prerequisites: Prerequisite:  Csci 112 or CIS 112 or Csci 251 or CIS 251 or Csci 256.Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPre-requisite: Non-engineering Majors Only

title: CIS 356: Data Structures in Python
description:
This course will introduce data structures and their application using
the Python programming language. Abstract data types for stack, queue,
various lists, trees and graphs will be studied. Built-in data
structures such as lists, dictionaries, and tuples will be used
extensively.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPre-requisite Csci 256 (C-) OR Csci 112 OR CIS 112 (C-) OR Csci 113 OR CIS 113 B-.

title: CIS 427: Network Security
description:
This course explores the concepts and methods of computer security with
an emphasis on network security and the appropriate tools to identify
and remedy vulnerabilities across leading network platforms. It
emphasizes both offensive and defensive analysis tools, including
scanners, sniffers, intrusion detection systems, and firewalls.
prerequisites: Csci 325: Foundations of Computer Security(Minimum grade: C-)Csci 361: Introduction to Computer Networks(Minimum grade: C-)Pre-requisite: 24 or more earned hours.

title: CIS 447: Immersive Media
description:
This course explores the applications, methods, and technologies for the
realization of immersive virtual environments. Students will develop
virtual reality applications, immersive virtual worlds, and interactive
media. Topics include virtual reality, augmented reality, 3D content
authoring, motion tracking, and current trends in immersive media.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: 24 or more earned hours.Prerequisite: Csci 211 or CIS 211 or Csci 343 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 103: Survey of Computing
description:
Introduction to computers and computing for students with no prior
computer experience.
prerequisites: Course cannot be booked if completed Csci 112/CIS 112 with a grade of C- or better OR Csci 113/CIS 113 with a grade of B- or better.

title: Csci 111: Computer Science I
description:
Introduction to computer science with emphasis on problem solving and
algorithm development.  Using high-level, block-structured programming
language, students design, implement, debug, test, and document computer
programs for various applications.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: Minimum ACT mathematics score of 22; or minimum SAT mathematics score of 540; or Math 121 or above; or ALEKS PPL score of 61Pre-Requisite: Engineering Majors Only

title: Csci 112: Computer Science II
description:
Continuation of CSCI 111 with emphasis on computer programming as a
systematic discipline.  The topics include data structures, abstract
data types, algorithm design and analysis, and programming methods and
standards.
prerequisites: Engineering students only.Prerequisite: Csci 111 or CIS 111 or Csci 113 or CIS 113 (Minimum grade C-).

title: Csci 113: Honors Computer Science I
description:
Introduction to computer science with an emphasis on problem solving and
algorithm development. Using high-level, block-structured programming
language, students will design, implement, debug, test, and document
computer programs.  In addition, topics related to data structures,
abstract data types, algorithm design and analysis will also be
emphasized.
prerequisites: Limited to students in the Sally McDonnell Barksdale Honors CollegePre-requisite: Math ACT 22 or Math 121 (or above)Engineering students only.

title: Csci 191: Office Applications
description:
Introduction to the use of computers with emphasis on the Windows
platform and the Microsoft Office suite of application tools. (Not to be
used to satisfy computer science major requirements).
prerequisites: Course cannot be booked if completed Csci 112/CIS 112 with a grade of C- or better OR Csci 113/CIS 113 with a grade of B- or better.

title: Csci 192: Computing Applications
description:
Introduction to the use of computers with emphasis on the Windows
platform and the WordPerfect suite of application tools. (Not to be used
to satisfy computer science major requirements).

title: Csci 193: Personal Computer Systems
description:
Study of the hardware and software components of personal computer
systems for experienced computer users. (Not to be used to satisfy
computer science major requirements).

title: Csci 203: Introduction to Computational Media
description:
This course introduces computing and programming with emphasis on
interactive media, including graphics, images, animation, and sound. It
explores core computing concepts such as variables, conditionals, loops,
functions, objects, arrays, and algorithms
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: Math ACT 22 or Math 121 (or above)Prerequisite: Math ACT 22 or Math SAT 550 or Math 115 (or above, excluding Math 120 and Math 167)

title: Csci 211: Computer Science III
description:
Continuation of Csci 112 with emphasis on advanced data structures,
algorithm design analysis, advanced programming techniques, and user
interfaces.
prerequisites: Engineering students only.Prerequisite: Csci 112 (minimum C-) or CIS 112 (minimum C-) or Csci 113 (minimum B-) or CIS 113 (minimum B-)

title: Csci 223: Computer Org. &  Assembly Language
description:
Introduction to the architecture of computer systems.  The topics
include processor and external device structures and operation, machine
operation, machine operations and instructions, assembly language
concepts, and assembly language programming.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: Csci 112 or CIS 112 (Minimum grade: C-); or Csci 113 or CIS 113 (Minimum grade: B-) or Csci 256 or CIS 256 (Minimum grade C-).

title: Csci 251: Programming for Engineering and Sciences
description:
Algorithm development and structured programming techniques; numerical
and graphical applications related to engineering and scientific problem
solving.
prerequisites: Engineering students only.Csci 251 Requires: One Way-Co-Requisite Math 261

title: Csci 256: Programming in Python
description:
Problem solving, algorithm development, and programming techniques,
including applications from a range of disciplines.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Minimum ACT mathematics score of 22; or minimum SAT mathematics score of 540; or Math 121 or above; or ALEKS PPL score of 61.

title: Csci 259: Programming in C++
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: Minimum ACT mathematics score of 22; or minimum SAT mathematics score of 540; or Math 121 or above; or ALEKS PPL score of 61Csci 111 or Csci 251

title: Csci 300: Social Responsibility in Comp. Science
description:
Study of the nature of and need for social responsibility and ethical
behavior in computing and the computer professions.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211 OR Csci 223 OR Csci 356 OR CIS 356.

title: Csci 305: Software for Global Use
description:
Study of the principles and practice of software internationalization
with emphasis on the design and customization of software to accommodate
linguistic and cultural diversity.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 311: Models of Computation
description:
Introduction to the theoretical foundations of computer science,
including automata and formal languages.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 112 or CIS 112 (Minimum grade: C-); or Csci 113 or CIS 113 (Minimum grade: B-)

title: Csci 323: Systems of Programming
description:
Study of a contemporary operating system and its set of tools from the
perspective of software professionals and system administrators.  The
course analyzes the system components and their interactions, the tool
environment, and system administration issues such as configuration,
installation, networking, security, and performance tuning.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 112 or CIS 112 (minimum grade: C-); or Csci 113 or CIS 113 (minimum grade: B-); or Csci 256 or CIS 256 (minimum grade: C-)

title: Csci 325: Foundations of Computer Security
description:
This course covers fundamental tools and concepts of computer security.
Topics include symmetric and asymmetric cryptography, cryptographic
hashing, basic security principles, and legal and ethical issues.
prerequisites: Csci 223: Computer Org. &  Assembly Language(Minimum grade: C-)Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned Hours

title: Csci 333: Digital Design and 3D Printing
description:
This course introduces the principles and methods for computer-aided
design of objects that can be rendered effectively on 3D printers. It
surveys the design techniques and the hardware and software technologies
in 3D printing workflows. Students create designs and render them on 3D
printers.
prerequisites: Prerequisite:  Csci 112 or CIS 112 or Csci 251 or CIS 251 or Csci 256.Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPre-Requisite: Engineering Majors Only

title: Csci 343: Fundamentals of Data Science
description:
Data science is the study of discovering knowledge from data. This
course explores the field using a broad perspective. Topics include data
collection and integration, exploratory data analysis, descriptive
statistics, prediction, and regression, and evaluating and communicating
results. Significant programming is required.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Csci 112 or CIS 112 or Csci 251 or CIS 251 or Csci 256; or Csci 113 or CIS 113 (Minimum grade: B-)Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned Hours

title: Csci 345: Information Storage and Retrieval
description:
Examination of systems for storage and retrieval of information in
textual and other formats.  The topics include query processing,
matching and ranking algorithms, text analysis, user interfaces, and
evaluation of retrieval effectiveness.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 or CIS 211 or Csci 343 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 353: Introduction to Numerical Methods
description:
This course provides an overview of numerical methods and optimization
techniques, laying the foundation for advanced studies in machine
learning, data science, and related engineering disciplines. It covers
fundamental concepts like numerical errors and algorithm efficiency,
delves into topics like interpolation, integration techniques, and
matrix factorization, and explores various computational topics
essential for data science and engineering.
prerequisites: Math 262: Unified Calculus & Analytic Geometry IIPre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 111 or CIS 111 or Csci 251 or CIS 251 or Csci 113 or CIS 113 or Csci 256 or CIS 256 or Csci 259.   (Minimum grade: C-)Csci 111 or Csci 251

title: Csci 354: Web Programming
description:
This course introduces programming for the World Wide Web. Topics
include development principles and practice with current Web development
tools such as HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, JSON, and PHP.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 or CIS 211 or Csci 343 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 356: Data Structures in Python
description:
This course will introduce data structures and their application using
the Python programming language. Abstract data types for stack, queue,
various lists, trees and graphs will be studied. Built-in data
structures such as lists, dictionaries, and tuples will be used
extensively.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPre-requisite Csci 256 (C-) OR Csci 112 OR CIS 112 (C-) OR Csci 113 OR CIS 113 B-.

title: Csci 361: Introduction to Computer Networks
description:
Analysis of loosely coupled computer communication protocols and network
services.  A generic network model is presented and compared to selected
examples of computer networks including the Internet TCP/IP and
Internet-based applications.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite Csci 223 OR El E 235

title: Csci 375: Introduction to Database Systems
description:
This course introduces database systems covering basic concepts and best
practices. Topics include data models (e.g., relational, object-
oriented, NoSQL), normalization, SQL, security and privacy, current
trends in data management, and web-to-database application programming.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 or CIS 211 or Csci 343 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 387: Software Design and Development
description:
Study of techniques for the construction of large, complex software
systems, including project management, requirements analysis,
specification, design, development, testing, documentation, deployment,
and maintenance.  Students develop software systems in a group structure
that simulates an industrial setting.
prerequisites: Csci 223: Computer Org. &  Assembly Language(Minimum grade: C-)Csci 375: Introduction to Database SystemsPre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 (C-) OR CIS 211 (C-) OR Csci 356 (C-) OR CIS 356 (C-).

title: Csci 390: Special Topics in Programming
description:
Study of topics in programming according to the interests of the
instructor and students.  May be repeated for credit when the topic
varies.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 391: Computer Graphics
description:
Introduction to the fundamentals of computer graphics, including
elementary figures, shading, geometric transformations, graphics program
design, and interactive techniques.
prerequisites: Math 262: Unified Calculus & Analytic Geometry IICsci 223: Computer Org. &  Assembly LanguagePre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 405: Computer Simulation
description:
Introduction to computer-based simulation and its applications to
engineering, the sciences, and management.
prerequisites: Math 262: Unified Calculus & Analytic Geometry IIPre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 423: Introduction to Operating Systems
description:
Study of the basic concepts of operating systems, including user
interfaces, process management, state saving, interprocess
communication, input/output, device drivers, timing services, memory
management, file management, and system abstractions.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Csci 211 (minimum grade C-) OR CIS 211 (minimum grade C-) OR  Csci 356 (minimum grade C-).Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite Csci 223 C- OR El E 385 C-

title: Csci 425: Code Generation and Optimization
description:
This course examines how machine code is generated and optimized to
harness the computing power of modern processors. The course surveys a
range of topics including the compilation process and techniques,
interface between software and hardware, and program optimizations at
different levels (e.g., algorithm, high-level, and assembly level).
prerequisites: Csci 223: Computer Org. &  Assembly LanguagePre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211

title: Csci 426: System Security
description:
This course covers the fundamentals of computer security with an
emphasis on computer systems security. Areas covered include operating
system security mechanisms, access control models, and other relevant
topics.
prerequisites: Csci 325: Foundations of Computer Security(Minimum grade: C-)Csci 423: Introduction to Operating Systems(Minimum grade: C-)Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned Hours

title: Csci 427: Network Security
description:
This course explores the concepts and methods of computer security with
an emphasis on network security and the appropriate tools to identify
and remedy vulnerabilities across leading network platforms. It
emphasizes both offensive and defensive analysis tools, including
scanners, sniffers, intrusion detection systems, and firewalls.
prerequisites: Csci 325: Foundations of Computer Security(Minimum grade: C-)Csci 361: Introduction to Computer Networks(Minimum grade: C-)Engineering students only.Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned Hours

title: Csci 431: Robotics Programming
description:
The goal of this course is to provide students hands-on experience in
the design, construction, and programming of robots that are driven by
micro-controllers (e.g., LEGO EV3 mobile robots). Upon completion of
this course, students should be able to develop a robotic system from
available modular units; to understand the role of knowledge
representation, problem solving, and learning in intelligent-system
engineering; and to explain the basic concepts of robotics systems.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211 OR Csci 223 OR Csci 356 OR CIS 356.

title: Csci 433: Algorithm and Data Structure Analysis
description:
Study of the design and analysis of algorithms and data structures.  The
topics include analysis techniques, sorting, searching, advanced data
structures, graphs, string matching, and NP-completeness.
prerequisites: Math 301: Discrete MathematicsPrerequisite: Csci 211 (minimum grade C-) OR CIS 211 (minimum grade C-) OR Csci 356 (minimum grade C-) OR CIS 356 (minimum grade C-).Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned Hours

title: Csci 443: Advanced Data Science
description:
This course extends the study in Csci 343 to processing and analysis of
big data.  Topics include machine learning, natural language processing,
and data intensive processing techniques such as MapReduce, NoSQL, and
other state-of-the-art frameworks.
prerequisites: Csci 343: Fundamentals of Data SciencePre-Requisite: 24 Earned Hours

title: Csci 444: Information Visualization
description:
This course introduces the principles and methods for data and
information visualization. It emphasizes the evaluation of alternative
visualizations and the design of presentations that enable people to
understand and analyze the information effectively. It addresses a
variety of data types, such as quantitative, categorical, topological,
geospatial, temporal, and unstructured data, and practical tools for
 rendering the visualizations.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 or CIS 211 or Csci 343 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 447: Immersive Media
description:
This course explores the applications, methods, and technologies for the
realization of immersive virtual environments. Students will develop
virtual reality applications, immersive virtual worlds, and interactive
media. Topics include virtual reality, augmented reality, 3D content
authoring, motion tracking, and current trends in immersive media.
prerequisites: Engineering students only.Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 or CIS 211 or Csci 343 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 450: Formal and Programming Languages
description:
Introductory course to the theoretical foundations of computer science,
including automata, formal language, history and concepts of programming
languages.
prerequisites: Csci 223: Computer Org. &  Assembly Language(Minimum grade: C-)Prerequisite: Csci 211 (minimum grade C-) OR CIS 211 (minimum grade C-) OR Csci 356 (minimum grade C-) OR CIS 356 (minimum grade C-).Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned Hours

title: Csci 458: Mobile Application Development
description:
This course introduces the design and development of cross-platform
mobile applications, focusing on effective design for mobile and desktop
browsers and conversion to native applications for common mobile
devices, such as Android and iOS. Topics include user interface design,
event handling, application programming interfaces (APIs) for accessing
hardware components (e.g., GPS, camera, accelerometer), and developing
for restricted resources, such as power, memory, and network speed.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 or CIS 211 or Csci 343 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 487: Senior Project
description:
Each student conducts an in-depth study of a current problem in
computer science or related area.  Upon completion, the student presents
the results in both oral and written form.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 387 OR Csci 443

title: Csci 490: Special Topics
description:
Study of topics in computer science according to the interests of the
instructor and students. May be repeated for credit when the topic
varies.
prerequisites: Csci 223: Computer Org. &  Assembly LanguagePre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 491: Special Topics in Computer Security
description:
Study of topics in computer security according to the interests of the
instructor and students. May be repeated for credit when the topic
varies.
prerequisites: Csci 325: Foundations of Computer Security(Minimum grade: C-)Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned Hours

title: Csci 492: Special Topics in Data Science
description:
Study of topics in data science according to the interests of the
instructor and students. May be repeated for credit when the topic
varies.
prerequisites: Pre-Requisite: 24 Earned HoursPrerequisite: Minimum grade of C- for all of the following courses: Csci 211 or CIS 211 or Csci 343 or Csci 356 or CIS 356

title: Csci 500: Fundamental Concepts in Computing
description:
An intensive study of the formal concepts needed for graduate study in
computer science.
prerequisites: Graduate Program Level Only

title: Csci 501: Fundamental Concepts in Systems
description:
An intensive study of the fundamental concepts of operating system and
machine structures and the associated programming techniques.
prerequisites: Graduate Program Level Only

title: Csci 502: Fundamental Concepts in Algorithms
description:
An intensive study of the fundamental concepts of algorithms and data
structures and the associated programming techniques.
prerequisites: Graduate Program Level Only

title: Csci 503: Fundamental Concepts in Languages
description:
An intensive study of the fundamental concepts of programming languages
and the associated software system structures.
prerequisites: Graduate Program Level Only

title: Csci 517: Natural Language Processing
description:
Computer processing of natural language text at morphological, lexical,
syntactic, and semantic levels; algorithms and procedures for sentence
parsing and analysis; applications of natural language processing
techniques.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequistie: Csci 211 or Csci 343

title: Csci 520: Formal Theory of Computer Languages
description:
A detailed study of mathematical models of regular and context-free
languages, nondeterministic and deterministic models; closure
properties, design algorithms, simplification of grammars.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: CSCI 311 or CSCI 500 or Graduate StandingPrerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).

title: Csci 521: Computer Systems Engineering
description:
Analysis of computer system components and manufacturing economics, and
how they influence design goals, direct architectural development,
create hardware/software issues and modify implementation concepts, as
well as system and circuit packaging.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: CSCI 423 or CSCI 501 or Graduate StandingPrerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).

title: Csci 523: Operating Systems
description:
Design and construction of operating systems for shared program
computers; various contemporary operating systems.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: CSCI 423 or CSCI 501 or Graduate StandingPrerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).

title: Csci 524: Distributed Operating System Design
description:
Analysis of operating system design principles for multiple computers; a
distributed operating system model is presented and compared to selected
network and distributed operating system examples.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: CSCI 423 or CSCI 501 or Graduate StandingPrerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).

title: Csci 525: Compiler Construction
description:
Introduction to techniques used in current compilers for computer
languages; the syntactic specification of programming languages and an
introduction to syntax-directed compiling.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: CSCI 311 or CSCI 450 or CSCI 500 or CSCI 503 or Graduate StandingPrerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).

title: Csci 526: Parallel Computing
description:
This course explores the conceptual, theoretical, and practical issues
raised by developing software for parallel environments and
architectures. Students will write several programs using different
languages and platforms.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequisite:  Csci 211 or CIS 211 or graduate standing.Prerequisite: Csci 223 or graduate standing.

title: Csci 530: Computer Architecture and Design
description:
This course studies the past evolution and current trends in computer
architecture and the factors influencing the design of hardware and
software components of computer systems. Topics include processor micro-
architecture, instruction set architecture, hardware parallelism, memory
subsystems, various processor design paradigms (superscalar, VLIW,
multicore, and GPU), and performance analysis.
prerequisites: Csci 223: Computer Org. &  Assembly LanguagePrerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).

title: Csci 531: Artificial Intelligence
description:
Use of the computer in human problem solving.  Game theory, decision
trees, Markov decision problems, selected topics.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: CSCI 433 or CSCI 502 or Graduate StandingPrerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).

title: Csci 533: Analysis of Algorithms
description:
Introduction to the analysis of the efficiency of computer algorithms
and concepts of computational complexity; sorting, matrix
multiplication, others.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: CSCI 433 or CSCI 502 or Graduate StandingPrerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).

title: Csci 541: Expert Systems and Logic Programming
description:
Expert systems and knowledge engineering.  Computer systems to emulate
human expertise.  Rule-based and other knowledge representation
techniques.  Knowledge engineering as a model for expert systems
development; logic programming for expert systems implementation.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211 or graduate standing.Prerequisite:  Math 301 or graduate standing

title: Csci 543: Data Mining
description:
This course focuses on techniques for analyzing large datasets to
identify patterns of information and organize them for use in decision
making. The topics include exploratory data analysis, classification,
clustering, text mining, web mining, recommender systems, and neural
networks as well as advanced topics covering the applications of data
mining in cross-cutting domains.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequiste: Csci 211 or CIS 211 or Csci 343 or graduate standing.

title: Csci 547: Digital Image Processing
description:
Present mathematical models for image formation. Introduce statistical,
geometric, and inferential methods to extract information from single
and multiple images. Discuss applications of computer vision.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequisite: Math 262 or graduate standing.Prerequisite:  Csci 211 or CIS 211 or Csci 251 or graduate standing.

title: Csci 550: Program Semantics and Derivation
description:
A study of formal methods for the specification, derivation, and
verification of computer programs.  Predicate logic; notations for
specification of programs; programming language semantics; calculational
techniques for derivation of programs; case studies.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211 or graduate standing.Prerequisite:  Math 301 or graduate standing

title: Csci 551: Computer System Performance Analysis
description:
Defining, parameterizing, and evaluating models of computer systems.
The emphasis is on applying queuing network models and simulation
techniques as tools to evaluate the performance of centralized and
distributed computer systems.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: (CSCI 423 and Math 375) or CSCI 501 or Graduate StandingPrerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).

title: Csci 554: Web Architecture and Programming
description:
Study of web architecture and programming tools. Analysis of
public-port protocols such as HTTP, embedded browser languages,
browser extensions and interoperability. Server-side web
components, design, tuning, and security. Server components include
HTTP, Common Gateway Interface, database engine, and extensions.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequisite: Csci 211 or CIS 211 or graduate standing.Prerequisite: Csci 223 or graduate standing.Csci 211 or Csci 223

title: Csci 555: Functional Programming
description:
The principles and techniques of programming with functions.  Purely
functional programming languages; recursion; higher-order functions;
reduction models; strictness; type systems; list operations; infinite
data structures; program synthesis and transformation.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211 OR graduate standingPrerequisite: Math 301 OR graduate standing

title: Csci 556: Multiparadigm Programming
description:
Principles and practices of software design and programming using
languages that feature explicit and convenient support for
multiple programming paradigms (e.g., imperative, object-oriented, and
functional).
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequisite: (Csci 211 or CIS 211) and Csci 223 or graduate standing

title: Csci 557: GPU Computing
description:
This course examines the use of GPU for general-purpose high performance
parallel computing. It covers the key principles, practices, and
hardware/software architectures for design of general-purpose, parallel
programs using GPUs. The course surveys and analyzes real-world
applications that benefit from GPUs, and involves hands-on programming
as well as performance profiling and analysis. The fundamentals of
concurrent programming and its challenges at algorithm and coding levels
are also discussed.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Pre-requisite (Csci 211 and Csci 223) OR (El E 385 and Csci 356) OR Graduate Standing

title: Csci 561: Computer Networks
description:
Analysis of loosely coupled computer communication, communication
protocols, and network services; an open systems interconnection model
is presented and compared to selected examples of computer networks.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequisite: Csci 423 or Csci 501 or graduate standing.

title: Csci 562: Software Engineering I
description:
Software engineering paradigms, requirement analysis and specification,
design of reliable software; data flow, data structure, and
object-oriented design methodologies.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: CSCI 387 or Graduate StandingPrerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).

title: Csci 575: Database Systems
description:
Review of database systems with special emphasis on data description and
manipulation languages; data normalization; functional dependencies;
database design; data integrity and security; distributed data
processing; design and implementation of a comprehensive project.
prerequisites: Pre-requisite: CSCI 423 or CSCI 475 or CSCI 501 or Graduate StandingPrerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).

title: Csci 581: Special Topics in Computer Science I
description: May be repeated for credit.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequisite: Csci 211 OR CIS 211 OR graduate standingPrerequisite:  Csci 223 OR graduate standing

title: Csci 582: Special Topics in Computer Science II
description: May be repeated for credit.
prerequisites: Prerequiste: Junior standing (60 hr).Prerequisite: (Csci 211 or CIS 211) and Csci 223 or graduate standing

title: Csci 632: Machine Learning
description:
Presents the theory of and algorithms for constructing computer programs
that automatically learn from experience. Introduces key concepts from
statistics, artificial intelligence, and computational complexity to the
design of practical machine learning systems.

title: Csci 658: Software Language Engineering
description:
Study of topics on the design, implementation, use, and
evolution of artificial languages for the engineering of software.
Languages of interest include general-purpose programming languages,
domain-specific languages, and modeling languages as well as application
programming interfaces and collections of design patterns that implicity
define languages.

title: Csci 663: Software Families
description:
Study of concepts, methods, patterns, and tools for the analysis,
design, and implementation of software families (e.g., software
frameworks and software product lines) and other reusable, generic, and
flexible programming artifacts.

title: Csci 665: Wireless and Sensor Networks
description:
This course uses wireless and sensor networks as case studies to enable
students to understand and analyze loosely coupled computer networks,
network protocols, and network services. Building on basic knowledge
about wireless and sensor networks, the course explores recent research
on related topics.  Students learn to use appropriate embedded
programming languages (e.g., nesC) and operating system platforms (e.g.,
TinyOS) to develop embedded and network programs. Students also learn to
design and implement mote-based wireless and sensor network systems by
completing a series of programming projects (e.g.,
multiple access control, multi-hop routing, and data collection from
sensors).
prerequisites: Csci 561: Computer Networks
